ygData.messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, February 02, 2000 8:30 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Mask of Deception
>
>
> From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
> >the mask's UV affect. While its not a big deal it is a bug
> and we should
> >probably send it in.
>
> It IS a big deal if it is also affecting the spell. I believe
> ENchanters and
> Shamans get the spell. (not sure about shamans) To cast the
> spell requires
> 1)
> memming it (Enchanters usually have enough spells needed that
> this spell
> would get swapped in and out) and 2) mana. If it is going to
> continually be
> dropped...

Hmm. I would expect Lyssa's Veracious Concord to affect people's ultravision
buffs as well. This would certainly make bards unpopular especially to the
races like Erudites, Humans and Barbarians who have normal vision.

> You might want to try the song that gives Infravision and see
> if it affects
> someone
> that has Serpent Sight up as well.
>
> Also, if an Enchanter has Illusion: dark elf up, does this
> song affect THAT
> Ultravision?

It wouldn't surprise me if it did given the way the bard songs overwrite
other spells' effects. This is something that'd be good to "bug" as I would
expect our song to not overwrite others' vision buffs. Point taken.

> From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
>
> *grin* Enchanters have been complaining recently about this
> for their whole
> Illusion series of spells. That we have a whole line that is
> just a "toy"
> now that they have changed the way it affects faction.
>
> Also, though, what might be affecting you is that they can see through
> illusion to your religion.

Yea, this has always been strange that NPC's can tell your religion by
looking at you, regardless of your illusion. It's about the only time
religion becomes a factor, and is why we have all these agnostic enchanters
in the game.

What was the change they made to the way illusions affects faction?

---Windleaf
